title: spack info: Spurious failures on Travis
body:
Travis is failing spuriously when trying to execute:
```python
spack info openmpi
```
during unit tests. The stacktrace we get back is something like:
```
__________________________ test_it_just_runs[openmpi] __________________________
pkg = 'openmpi'
    @pytest.mark.parametrize('pkg', [
        'openmpi',
        'trilinos',
        'boost',
        'python',
        'dealii'
    ])
    def test_it_just_runs(pkg):
>       info(pkg)
../../../lib/spack/spack/test/cmd/info.py:40: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
../../../lib/spack/spack/main.py:406: in __call__
    self.command, self.parser, args, unknown)
../../../lib/spack/spack/main.py:355: in _invoke_spack_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
../../../lib/spack/spack/cmd/info.py:241: in info
    print_text_info(pkg)
../../../lib/spack/spack/cmd/info.py:231: in print_text_info
    when.colorized(), ', '.join(s.colorized() for s in specs)
../../../lib/spack/spack/spec.py:2670: in colorized
    return colorize_spec(self)
../../../lib/spack/spack/spec.py:240: in colorize_spec
    return colorize(re.sub(_separators, insert_color(), str(spec)) + '@.')
/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/re.py:182: in sub
    return _compile(pattern, flags).sub(repl, string, count)
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
self = <spack.spec.colorize_spec.<locals>.insert_color object at 0x7fd970749550>
match = <_sre.SRE_Match object; span=(0, 1), match='o'>
    def __call__(self, match):
        # ignore compiler versions (color same as compiler)
        sep = match.group(0)
        if self.last == '%' and sep == '@':
            return cescape(sep)
        self.last = sep
    
>       return '%s%s' % (color_formats[sep], cescape(sep))
E       KeyError: 'o'
../../../lib/spack/spack/spec.py:238: KeyError
```
The problem first occurred in #4994, and after trying without success to reproduce the issue both on Travis and locally I discarded it as some strange environment problem (like the ones we get from time to time regarding `svn` failing). Unfortunately, it happened again when building on `develop` [in build 12355](https://travis-ci.org/LLNL/spack/builds/265784067). Restarting the two failing builds made the issue disappear.
